name: lucidity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being able to think clearly, especially when this is temporary: He has intervals of lucidity.
the quality of expressing something clearly: The essay demonstrates this with lucidity and conviction. See
lucid
More examplesFewer examples Later, during a brief moment of lucidity, she seemed to recognize him. Even her dementia-stricken mother pops up with moments of lucidity at exactly the right time. The orchestra played for their guest with the lucidity and cohesive beauty it always brings to this composer's music.He is known not only for his enormous output, totaling 105 books, but also for the lucidity of his language. Regardless, the lucidity and energy of the drawings alone are a revelation.
